Tasks.Task Description: Identify the goals and objectives for using Azure Event Hubs in analytics. Determine the data sources, expected throughput, and analytics requirements.
Analyze the volume, velocity, and variety of data to be ingested into Azure Event Hubs. Identify the data producers and their integration points.

Tasks.Task: Design Event Hub Namespace and Configuration
Tasks.Task Description: Plan the namespace structure, partitioning strategy, and throughput units based on analytics requirements. Ensure scalability and fault tolerance.
Create the Event Hub namespace and configure the Event Hubs in the Azure portal or using CLI/PowerShell. Set up partitions and throughput units.
Configure access control using Azure RBAC and Shared Access Signatures (SAS). Enable encryption for data at rest and in transit.
Set up data producers to send events to Azure Event Hubs. Use SDKs, APIs, or connectors for integration.
Set up data consumers to read events from Azure Event Hubs. Use Azure Stream Analytics, Apache Spark, or other analytics tools.
Set up monitoring for Event Hub metrics such as incoming requests, throughput, and errors. Configure alerts for critical thresholds.
Perform end-to-end testing of data ingestion, processing, and analytics. Validate data accuracy and system performance.
Analyze system performance and optimize throughput units, partitioning, and consumer group configurations.
Create detailed documentation of the Event Hub setup, data flow, and analytics processes. Include troubleshooting steps and operational guidelines.
Train the operations team on managing Azure Event Hubs, monitoring metrics, and troubleshooting issues.
Ensure the setup adheres to regulatory compliance requirements. Schedule regular audits to verify security and operational standards.
